user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of process_multipart_headers:
```c
static int
process_multipart_headers (struct MHD_PostProcessor *pp,
                           size_t *ioffptr,
                           enum PP_State next_state)
{
  char *buf = (char *) &pp[1];
  size_t newline;

  newline = 0;
  while ( (newline < pp->buffer_pos) &&
          (buf[newline] != '\r') &&
          (buf[newline] != '\n') )
    newline++;
  if (newline == pp->buffer_size)
  {
    pp->state = PP_Error;
    return MHD_NO;              /* out of memory */
  }
  if (newline == pp->buffer_pos)
    return MHD_NO;              /* will need more data */
  if (0 == newline)
  {
    /* empty line - end of headers */
    pp->skip_rn = RN_Full;
    pp->state = next_state;
    return MHD_YES;
  }
  /* got an actual header */
  if (buf[newline] == '\r')
    pp->skip_rn = RN_OptN;
  buf[newline] = '\0';
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ ("Content-disposition: ",
                                 buf,
                                 MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-disposition: ")))
  {
    try_get_value (&buf[MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-disposition: ")],
                   "name",
                   &pp->content_name);
    try_get_value (&buf[MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-disposition: ")],
                   "filename",
                   &pp->content_filename);
  }
  else
  {
    try_match_header ("Content-type: ",
                      MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-type: "),
                      buf,
                      &pp->content_type);
    try_match_header ("Content-Transfer-Encoding: ",
                      MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-Transfer-Encoding: "),
                      buf,
                      &pp->content_transfer_encoding);
  }
  (*ioffptr) += newline + 1;
  return MHD_YES;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function process_multipart_headers:
int
MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ (const char *const str1,
                           const char *const str2,
                           size_t maxlen)
{
  size_t i;

  for (i = 0; i < maxlen; ++i)
  {
    const char c1 = str1[i];
    const char c2 = str2[i];
    if (0 == c2)
      return 0 == c1;
    if (charsequalcaseless (c1, c2))
      continue;
    else
      return 0;
  }
  return ! 0;
}
...
static void
try_get_value (const char *buf,
               const char *key,
               char **destination)
{
  const char *spos;
  const char *bpos;
  const char *endv;
  size_t klen;
  size_t vlen;

  if (NULL != *destination)
    return;
  bpos = buf;
  klen = strlen (key);
  while (NULL != (spos = strstr (bpos, key)))
  {
    if ( (spos[klen] != '=') ||
         ( (spos != buf) &&
           (spos[-1] != ' ') ) )
    {
      /* no match */
      bpos = spos + 1;
      continue;
    }
    if (spos[klen + 1] != '"')
      return;                   /* not quoted */
    if (NULL == (endv = strchr (&spos[klen + 2],
                                '\"')))
      return;                   /* no end-quote */
    vlen = (size_t) (endv - spos) - klen - 1;
    *destination = malloc (vlen);
    if (NULL == *destination)
      return;                   /* out of memory */
    (*destination)[vlen - 1] = '\0';
    memcpy (*destination,
            &spos[klen + 2],
            vlen - 1);
    return;                     /* success */
  }
}
...
static int
try_match_header (const char *prefix,
                  size_t prefix_len,
                  char *line,
                  char **suffix)
{
  if (NULL != *suffix)
    return MHD_NO;
  while (0 != *line)
  {
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ (prefix,
                                   line,
                                   prefix_len))
    {
      *suffix = strdup (&line[prefix_len]);
      return MHD_YES;
    }
    ++line;
  }
  return MHD_NO;
}
...
_MHD_static_inline bool
charsequalcaseless (const char c1, const char c2)
{
  return ( (c1 == c2) ||
           (isasciiupper (c1) ?
            ((c1 - 'A' + 'a') == c2) :
            ((c1 == (c2 - 'A' + 'a')) && isasciiupper (c2))) );
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ ("Content-disposition: ",
                                 buf,
                                 MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-disposition: "))) 
  {
    try_get_value (&buf[MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-disposition: ")],
                   "name",
                   &pp->content_name);
    try_get_value (&buf[MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-disposition: ")],
                   "filename",
                   &pp->content_filename);
  }
  else
  {
    try_match_header ("Content-type: ",
                      MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-type: "),
                      buf,
                      &pp->content_type);
    try_match_header ("Content-Transfer-Encoding: ",
                      MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-Transfer-Encoding: "),
                      buf,
                      &pp->content_transfer_encoding);
  }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: process_multipart_headers calls MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_, try_get_value and try_match_header. Those functions in turn call helpers (charsequalcaseless, strchr, strstr, strdup, malloc, etc.) and do not call process_multipart_headers or each other in a way that would form a call cycle. Therefore there is no direct or indirect recursion in the shown fragment.
